text:
2015 to date: Saudi Aramco – Dhahran, KSA
Position: Capital Program Analysis Specialist – Values Range to $ Multibillion
He is one of a small group of senior leaders reporting directly to the Senior Vice President and working within the Project Management Organisation. His role is to analyse and advise on the capital program of projects to help steer the individual project managers / engineers and consequently advise senior management for key decisions such as business viability and strategic fit, funding, organisation, procurement and contracting options, technical completeness and finally risks and readiness to proceed.
The capital portfolio ranges from small to mega projects for Company, Joint Ventures, Acquisitions, and Government strategic projects. Most projects within the program ar 2015 to date: Saudi Aramco – Dhahran, KSA
Position: Capital Program Analysis Specialist – Values Range to $ Multibillion
He is one of a small group of senior leaders reporting directly to the Senior Vice President and working within the Project Management Organisation. His role is to analyse and advise on the capital program of projects to help steer the individual project managers / engineers and consequently advise senior management for key decisions such as business viability and strategic fit, funding, organisation, procurement and contracting options, technical completeness and finally risks and readiness to proceed.
The capital portfolio ranges from small to mega projects for Company, Joint Ventures, Acquisitions, and Government strategic projects. Most projects within the program are executed on a lump sum turnkey and lump sum procure build basis.
Additionally, he served as a core team member to design and implement an Oracle based Enterprise Project Management system now utilized throughout the capital program; and he consistently works within teams to optimize the processes for project execution.
2009 – 2015 Jacobs Engineering – Reading, UK
Nov 2014 – Mar 2015
Position: Engineering Manager – BP Khazzan Project, Oman – $ Multibillion value
Requested to be an interim manager to drive the detailed engineering delivery. His scope included developing a new budget, enhancing project controls reporting, and ensuring teams were suitably resourced.
The Client requested for him to join the project on a permanent basis and move with the project to Oman to manage the delivery of the engineering from in-house and subcontractors based in the UK, India, and UAE offices.
His team included approximately 250 engineers.
Jul 2014 – Oct 2014
Position: Project Director – Coryton, UK Refinery Conversion (JV – Shell, Greenergy, Vopak)
A politically complex yet smaller project where he was asked to assume the leadership of the existing site team for finalising the detail design and construction work packages for the conversion of the refinery to a bulk storage terminal. This project was cancelled due to funding issues.
Dec 2009 – Jun 2014
Position: Project Director / Senior Project Manager – $2B Power & Water Facility, Saudi Arabia
Marafiq Yanbu 2 project produces 690MWe, 60,000m3/day of potable and process water, and 150,000m3/h of seawater cooling for the local Yanbu industrial city and interfaces with Saudi Aramco facilities.
He led this project from concept through to construction completion. In addition to initial standard project execution activities such as FEED and Request for Proposal development, his role included business case development, project and operations budget forecasts, Marafiq board presentations, prequalification of bidders, economic evaluations, contractor selection and contract negotiations for five LSTK Contracts.
His role included coordinating and leading engineering delivery from several offices with a team of around 300 engineers during FEED, based in several offices in the UK, USA, and India. The project engineering locations were expanded during detail design to include UK teams in South Korea and Greece.
In addition to engineering checks during detail design, he managed the procurement process from drawing up initial vendors lists, vendor qualification and selection, equipment, and material inspections, expediting, and delivery.
He was also accountable for the internal Jacob’s PMC budgets and profitability targets.
Apr 2008 – Dec 2009 Aker Solutions – Port Solent, UK
Position: Senior Project Manager
He was seconded to BP. His role was to lead the BP team to facilitate the integration of the Vivergo biofuels project, a Joint Venture company, into the brownfield site in a contractually and politically challenging environment. Feasibility and financial study with UK Government, Shell, Mott Macdonald, Aker Clean Carbon, and Scottish Power for a $1B Carbon Capture Project.
Position: Engineering Manager – Dow Corning 3 Pillars Project ($1.8B).
Led the finalization and handover to the team in China of the detail engineering scope, and the expediting and prioritization of specialised equipment procurement within E

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
